interfaces.explore.histogram

Interface HistogramInterface


  • public interface HistogramInterface
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Learning Orchestra
    Summary:
    This interface is responsible to create a histogram from a dataset attribute

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      com.google.gson.JsonObject await(java.lang.String histogramURL) 
      com.google.gson.JsonObject deleteHistogramAsync(java.lang.String histogramName) 
      com.google.gson.JsonObject deleteHistogramSync(java.lang.String histogramName) 
      com.google.gson.JsonObject runHistogramAsync(java.lang.String datasetName, java.lang.String histogramName, java.lang.String attribute) 
      com.google.gson.JsonObject runHistogramSync(java.lang.String datasetName, java.lang.String histogramName, java.lang.String attribute) 
      com.google.gson.JsonObject searchAllHistograms() 
      com.google.gson.JsonObject searchHistogram(java.lang.String histogramName, int pageSize, int currentPage) 

    • Method Detail

      • runHistogramSync

        com.google.gson.JsonObject runHistogramSync(java.lang.String datasetName,
                                            java.lang.String histogramName,
                                            java.lang.String attribute)
        Parameters:
        datasetName - represents the dataset name
        histogramName - represents the histogram name to be used forward
        attribute - represents the attribute used to plot the histogram
        Returns:
        a JSON object with error or warning messages. In case of success, it returns the histogram URL inside the JSON object.
        Summary:
        this method runs the histogram algorithm synchronously, this way the caller waits until the execution finishes.

      • runHistogramAsync

        com.google.gson.JsonObject runHistogramAsync(java.lang.String datasetName,
                                             java.lang.String histogramName,
                                             java.lang.String attribute)
        Parameters:
        datasetName - represents the dataset name
        histogramName - represents the histogram name to be used forward
        attribute - represents the attribute used to plot the histogram
        Returns:
        a JSON object with error or warning messages. In case of success, it returns the histogram URL inside the JSON object.
        See Also:
        method for wait condition strategy
        Summary:
        this method runs the histogram algorithm asynchronously, this way the caller does not wait until the execution finishes.

      • await

        com.google.gson.JsonObject await(java.lang.String histogramURL)
        Parameters:
        histogramURL - is the histogram URL returned by asynchronous method calls of Learning Orchestra API
        Returns:
        a JSON object indicating if the histogram is created correctly or not
        Summary:
        This method is responsible to lock the caller until the histogram is created correctly into Learning Orchestra

      • deleteHistogramSync

        com.google.gson.JsonObject deleteHistogramSync(java.lang.String histogramName)
        Parameters:
        histogramName - represents the histogram name
        Returns:
        a JSON object with an error message, a warning message or a correct delete message
        Summary:
        This method is responsible for deleting the histogram. This delete operation is synchronous, so it locks the caller until the deletion finished.

      • deleteHistogramAsync

        com.google.gson.JsonObject deleteHistogramAsync(java.lang.String histogramName)
        Parameters:
        histogramName - represents the histogram name
        Returns:
        a JSON object with an error message, a warning message or a correct delete message
        Summary:
        This method is responsible for deleting the histogram. This delete operation is asynchronous, so it does not lock the caller until the deletion finished. Instead, it returns a JSON object with a URL for a future use. The caller uses the URL for delete checks.

      • searchAllHistograms

        com.google.gson.JsonObject searchAllHistograms()
        Returns:
        all histograms metadata stored in Learning Orchestra or an empty result
        Summary:
        This method retrieves all histograms metadata, i.e., it does not retrieve the histogram content.

      • searchHistogram

        com.google.gson.JsonObject searchHistogram(java.lang.String histogramName,
                                           int pageSize,
                                           int currentPage)
        Parameters:
        histogramName - is the name of the histogram
        pageSize - is the number of tuples or registers returned per page. It is an optional parameter. If not present, the page size will be 20 tuples/registers.
        currentPage - is the page where the search will start. It is an optional parameter. If not present, the search operation will start from page zero.
        Returns:
        a page with some tuples or registers inside or an error if there is no such histogram. The current page is also returned to be used in future content requests.
        Summary:
        This method is responsible for retrieving pages of the histogram content
